title: Is it likely that we will discover a method for space travel, taking advantage of space-time relativity? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have answered this question many times, and I will try to answer your question so quora does not collapse it on grounds that I plagiarized the answer even though it is my own copyrighted material. You can also find the answer at http://www.creationoftheuniverse.org/ —- http://www.aslodge.com/time There is “ NO“ space-time, gravity works just fine by itself. TIME and EXISTENCE Time is just a “ MEASUREMENT “. It is constant wherever you are. The accuracy of the instrument you use will be influenced by gravity, centrifugal force, heat, and a few other variables. Time in not a “ FORCE “. There is no time “ DIMENSION “. There is no possibility of time “ TRAVEL “. All that exists, does so in the present " INDIVISIBLE " moment.

No. “Space-time relativity” is a fictional concept with no empirical evidence to make it real science. GR’s gravitational calculation doesn’t need this non-entity. Gravity is still a force propagated through space without the need for some fictional fabric “curved by mass” which “guides the movement of masses.” We already use gravity to boost velocity for space travel. It’s called the sling-shot effect, well known to all “rocket scientists.” (No “curved space-time” involved.”)

Space travel is inevitable. Space time relatively is a misconception and is based on how things appear. The universe is more than how it appears. There is no absolute space or absolute time, therefore, there cannot be an absolute speed. All we need to do is design faster propulsion systems. As the whole universe is there to be explored.
